alert.note: Alert for Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 8:58AM EDT until July 14 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Panhandle Florida, including the following county, Walton. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 758 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... De Funiak Springs, Eglin Air Force Base, Freeport, New Home, Pleasant Ridge, Rock Hill, Portland, Alpine Heights, De Funiak Spring Airport, Oakwood Hills, Mossy Head, Center Ridge, Villa Tasso and Pleasant Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
